body: @ArchanGhosh I'm not sure `.\mlruns\1` was created but removing it should resolve the error. `meta.yaml` should be created if you're using `FileStore`.

@ArchanGhosh Never mind the comment above. When running `mlflow ui`, you need to specify the tracking URI using `--backend-store-uri` like:

```
mlflow ui --backend-store-uri sqlite:///mlflow.db
```

> @ArchanGhosh Never mind the comment above. When running `mlflow ui`, you need to specify the tracking URI using `--backend-store-uri` like:
> 
> ```
> mlflow ui --backend-store-uri sqlite:///mlflow.db
> ```

This worked out thank you so much. In any case we can modify the mlflow serve command in a similar manner so that I can serve a particular model based on run ID

@ArchanGhosh Can you try running this command?

```shell
MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI=sqlite:///mlflow.db mlflow models serve --model-uri runs:/e2fc4c05beea4b9a89096037b58921cd/model
```

> @ArchanGhosh Can you try running this command?
> 
> ```shell
> MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI=sqlite:///mlflow.db mlflow models serve --model-uri runs:/e2fc4c05beea4b9a89096037b58921cd/model
> ```

Not Working as MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI is not being recognized both in upper and lower case
This looks like an issue. `mlflow models serve` doesn't seem to provide a way to set the tracking URI.

In my test `MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI=sqlite:///mlflow.db mlflow models serve --model-uri runs:/...` works, and according to the code:  https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/c2cf7cfa3487e15cda112cb1823fe00ef4bf3f8d/mlflow/tracking/_tracking_service/utils.py#L135 it should work.

What's your error running that ? @ArchanGhosh

``` python
>MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI=sqlite:///mlflow.db mlflow models serve --model-uri runs:/e2fc4c05beea4b9a89096037b58921cd/model

operable program or batch file.

>mlflow_tracking_uri=sqlite:///mlflow.db mlflow models serve --model-uri runs:/
e2fc4c05beea4b9a89096037b58921cd/model
'mlflow_tracking_uri' is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.
```

this is the error I am getting
ah... I got it. You are using Windows, in Windows we cannot set environment variable in this way. (Windows recognize your command `mlflow_tracking_uri` as a program name)

@ArchanGhosh 

You can do:

```
set MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI=sqlite:///mlflow.db
mlflow models serve --model-uri runs:/e2fc4c05beea4b9a89096037b58921cd/model
```
it should work on windows. :)
